features: Helps maintain healthy bones, cartilages, gums and teeth in kids;* Vitamin C is a vital antioxidant that supports your little one’s immune system for overall health and well-being*
500 mg of vitamin C delivered in a fruit-flavored, chewable wafer that’s perfect for children;* Protects against free radical damage and aids healthy cell growth*
Contains supportive ingredients like citrus bioflavonoids, hesperidin, rosehips and rutin that work with Vitamin C to promote antioxidant efficacy*
Chew 1 wafer daily; Our vitamin C supplement is plant-based, non-GMO and suitable for vegans and vegetarians
Independently tested and third-party certified for GMOs and over 800 contaminants using advanced technology such as mass spectrometry to ensure purity and potency

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Support your kids’ bones, cartilages, gums and teeth with this Vitamin C 500 mg supplement. These fruit-flavored wafers are a delicious way for little ones to get their daily dose of vitamin C. Bolster your children’s immune health with this powerful antioxidant that helps fight free radical damage. Our vitamin C wafers are plant-based and sourced sustainably. These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Vitamin C, 500 mg Quercetin LipoMicel Matrix, 250 mg Whole Earth & Sea Vitamin D3, 125 mcg Anti-V Formula Key Benefits Supports immune function and helps build and maintain bones, cartilage, teeth and gums Supports your cardiovascular, respiratory and overall health Supports healthy bone development and immune system Immune-supporting blend of herbal ingredients like organic Echinacea, reishi, astragalus, licorice root and lomatium No artificial colors, flavors, or preservatives ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free, non-GMO ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Usage Chew 1 wafer daily Take 1 softgel per day or up to 3 times daily Take 1 capsule daily Take 1 softgel 2 times per day

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great source of vitamin C
reviews.reviewText: These provide a substantial amount of vitamin C in an easy to chew pill that tastes good. I take so many supplements, it’s nice to have some that can be chewed, rather than swallowed, and these taste pleasant without having a lot of calories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kids chewable 500 mg. Vitamin C
reviews.reviewText: These were the only chewable vitamin C that were 500 mg. They are very sour, but other than that my kids are getting used to them. Will purchase these again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Quality product, as advertised - Tastes good easy to chew

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2011
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Taste great! Berry Flavor, no citrus!
reviews.reviewText: Awesome, great tasting vitamin C chewables! The berry tastes awesome & these are easy on the stomach.Vitamin C is essential to wound-hearing & prevention of long-term, chronic pain problems down the road. It can also help if you already have pain issues.IMHO, everyone who has had surgery or an injury to a limb, I'd take 3,000-5,000mg/day for roughly 6 weeks, then taper down to a regular every day dose. My chiropractor gave me an article from a chiropractic journal on the prevention of CRPS/RSD after surgery & injury to limbs, and a good vitamin C supplement reduces the chance by roughly 6-fold of developing RSD or CRPS.In addition, we all know that vitamin C has other antioxidant properties & thus health benefits.These taste like a tart candy (very much like sour sweet tarts!)For those who can't take citrus, yet need a vitamin C supplement, these are a great solution!For those of us who don't, they really taste great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Vitamin C great product but this flavor just not for us we like the other flavors.
reviews.reviewText: Like the other fruit flavors ones this one is kinda weird taste I did not like it and kids either. But they are a great source of vitamin C. Easy to chew.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Chewability, taste, and ingredients
reviews.reviewText: Had been looking long and hard for a chewable 500 mg C and finally ran across this one, which I intend to re-order. I was surprised to read another review saying they were "bitter" because that's definitely not the word. "Tart" is the correct one, just like when you run across a tart fruit or berry. Since I don't use artificial sweeteners, or even like the taste of things too sweet, this is the perfect chewable C for me (as a matter of fact, I ended up returning the Kirkland brand for the very reason that the sweetness almost made me gag (and if you check those ingredients you'll see the load of mixed artificial sweeteners). Since absorption begins in the mouth, it's always best to take chewable supplements whenever you can, so I strongly recommend this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Check ingredients if you have allergies
reviews.reviewText: The ingredients shown in the picture for the Blueberry, Raspberry, Boysenberry flavor are different than the ingredients listed on the bottle I received. The bottle lists strawberry. So if you have allergies, check the label on the bottle you receive. This must be a new formulation, because the Blueberry, Rapsberry, Boysenberry flavor I bought previously didn't list strawberries. Otherwise great vitamins.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars In past version, berries came PRIOR to mag.stearate. More real.
reviews.reviewText: You can fool some of the people some of the time, but not ALL of the people ALL of the time. Why? Because approx. 75% of the populace are not supertasters.Thus, even if this product became off-flavor since the past (due to changing the order of ingredients) medium-tasters or non-tasters may not detect it.Below is the proof of change:I have a bottle with a 2012 exp.date which i'd kept in my fridge & one chewable-tablet is left of that one.I have the 2012 bottle next to the 2017 bottle which I just purchased via Amazon.You better believe, the quality is warped compared to the past. It has a weird off-taste.The 2012(exp.) Berry-C tastes yummy by comparison to my newly purchased 2017-version.Of note is that its yummy even though its way older! (albeit fridge of course)So I checked the ingredients of the 2012(exp.) bottle compared to the 2017(exp.)Sure enough, see the change below, however miniscule it may seem.(i.e. in the 2012 version:...there were more of the berry flavors than of the mag.sterate.Whereas in the 2017 version:...there's more of the mag.stearate than the berry flavors.And indeed, the coloring of the 2012(exp.) tablet was deeper-rosier-looking, whereas the 2017(exp.) version has more of a paler-bluish tint."OTHER" INGREDIENTS OF THE 2012-EXPIRATION BOTTLE:Dextrose, fructose, color (red cabbage), flavors (blueberry, raspberry & boysenberry), magnesium stearate (vegetable grade), citric acid, citrus bioflavonoids, hesperidin bioflavonoids, rosehips, rutin, silica."OTHER" INGREDIENTS OF THE 2017-EXPIRATION BOTTLE:Dextrose, fructose, natural color (red cabbage), magnesium stearate (vegetable grade), natural flavor (blueberry, raspberry & boysenberry), citric acid, citrus bioflavonoids, hesperidin bioflavonoids, rosehips, rutin, silica.
The best fighting I've seen that I've ever tasted. ❤️ Sweet and Tangy dissolves easily .

reviews.reviewTitle: Great item - just did not like the flavour. Orange flavour very good though!
reviews.reviewText: My family loves this product in the orange flavour.We thought to try it in the this assorted berry and my family did not like this flavour at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product for a good price.
reviews.reviewText: Love these vitamins but this flavor is horrible . Great price though. We were buying a smaller bottle locally for more than what I paid for this large bottle.
